metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15134 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A stack buffer overflow flaw was found in the way 389-ds-base 1.3.6.x before 1.3.6.13, 1.3.7.x before 1.3.7.9, 1.4.x before 1.4.0.5 handled certain LDAP search filters. A remote, unauthenticated attacker could potentially use this flaw to make ns-slapd crash via a specially crafted LDAP request, thus resulting in denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15134` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.3.7.9-1
389-ds-base - 1.3.7.9-1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.3.7.9-1
python3-dirsrvtests - 1.3.7.9-1
python3-lib389 - 1.3.7.9-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.7.9-1').
